comments.body:
@yxieca: I am now of the belief that we should simply consider the platform.json file required, and fail any tests which rely on its data if it's not available. This will result in more consistency across platforms. When we first designed the tests, this data was more of an "enhanced" version of the tests, but I believe it should now be mandatory.

Here is a PR for the chassis and SFP tests: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/pull/2268

latestReviews.body:
My only concern is that these warnings will be ignored. Had a discussion with Joe offline regarding this on another PR.

I think we could add a specific test to test that platform.json exists and that test can fail and indicating work needed. If the test could further validate required fields and failing on them too, then these warnings are fine.

@yxieca: We could separate the fact comparison test to a new test case, but the idea is is to raise attention to the fact that the vendor has not yet provided a platform.json file for the platform. I worry that skipping tests might make it go unnoticed.

> @yxieca: We could separate the fact comparison test to a new test case, but the idea is is to raise attention to the fact that the vendor has not yet provided a platform.json file for the platform. I worry that skipping tests might make it go unnoticed.

good point. in this case, then, separate test case and fail the test case when platform.json is missing is more explicit than warning.

> in this case, then, separate test case and fail the test case when platform.json is missing is more explicit than warning.

I was planning to eventually make the platform.json check mandatory, once vendors had time to implement, but I wasn't planning to separate the test cases, as it will make the test run much longer. Maybe we should just make both the platform.json and inventory file checks mandatory now?
Retest this please
Retest this please

In the PR description, what pytest command line arguments were used for running the script for test? On which platform was the test script executed?

> In the PR description, what pytest command line arguments were used for running the script for test? On which platform was the test script executed?

The Platform I ran the sample script is broadcom, and there is nothing special in command line
```
py.test --inventory $INVT --host-pattern $DUT_NAME --module-path $MPATH --testbed $TESTBED_NAME --testbed_file $TESTBED_FILE --junit-xml=tr.xml --log-cli-level ${LOG_LEVEL} --collect_techsupport=False --topology='t0,any,util' platform_tests/demo/test_asic.py
```

Eventually, we will need to restructure these tests so as to handle modular chassis. Since fans can be contained in a number of other device types, I think it makes for the container device to run the fan tests on all fans contained within it. Until we refactor the tests to achieve this, however, I believe this fan test should test not only the fans directly on the chassis, but also in fan drawers and PSUs, rather than duplicating this code in the fan drawer and PSU tests. @vdahiya12: What do you think?

I have two questions:
1. which test case caused this symptom?
2. Should we remove the redundant log entry?

> I have two questions:
> 
> 1. which test case caused this symptom?
> 2. Should we remove the redundant log entry?

1. All test cases
2. We could remove the redundant log entry, but other packages could reproduce this issue in the future. This issue blocks testing the main functionality of SONiC so we should suppress it. The Dev team is working on the issue with the redundant log entry.

> Would this file also need to be change to reflect the unified graph?
> 
> https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/7d99e36a9439571e9ed51cb4634a5b42cb0ff17c/ansible/group_vars/all/inv_mapping.yml#L3

I don't think so. That map is still correct. The official lab graph is lab_connection_graph.xml. The new file I added is a truly empty graph file.

> Would this file also need to be change to reflect the unified graph?
> 
> https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/7d99e36a9439571e9ed51cb4634a5b42cb0ff17c/ansible/group_vars/all/inv_mapping.yml#L3

Lawrence, I looked at the pytest conn_graph code again and I think your question makes lots of sense. I think we could potentially ditch the inventory graph map file and use this lookup method for all. But I think we could come back with another PR for that change.

Why can't we use the --deep-clean option just for 7060?

> Why can't we use the --deep-clean option just for 7060?

I have `--deep-clean` enabled for `7060`, but `/var/log` directory got low space during the test session, so it is needed to clean up before the running of `LogAnalyzer` for each test function.

Has this started failing recently? If yes, we need to figure out what changed

No test is using `reboot` recover method yet. But if it does, recover by reboot would not work if the sonic-mgmt docker cannot resolve DUT hostname. I have verified this by temporarily updating a test script to use `reboot` recover method.

comments.body: retest this please

I post an update.
1. The fixture **check_dut_asic_type** is set  **autouse=True**. 
I didn't find a more elegant way that is both user friendly and doesn't introduce  unnecessary check for other cases. IMO, the performance impact can be ignored
2. Support assign muiti platforms in markers
```
@pytest.mark.asic('mellanox', 'Broadcom')
```

Update: A hook **pytest_collection_modifyitems** is used to determine whether the fixture **check_dut_asic_type** is used. So the fixture is set to not autouse. The newly added hook introduces a generic method to control fixture dynamically. Thanks @wangxin

@bingwang-ms I have a question here.
What sonic image did you use?
I tested my PR with 201811.83 and 201911.(latest two weeks ago) and that worked on 6100 platform.
Also vs tested it in PR and the test worked smoothly.
Now we're seeing a bug in the test.
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/pull/1944

> @bingwang-ms I have a question here.
> What sonic image did you use?
> I tested my PR with 201811.83 and 201911.(latest two weeks ago) and that worked on 6100 platform.
> Also vs tested it in PR and the test worked smoothly.
> Now we're seeing a bug in the test.
> #1944

I tested on an Arista-7260 DUT, and the SONiC image version is SONiC Software Version: SONiC.20191130.45.
The test_bgp_speaker_announce_routes_v6 will fail if there is no neighbor info for fc02:1000::2/3/4. But it will pass after I run 
ping -6 fc02:1000::X. I noticed the commend Line 122-125, and guess that it may cause by similar reason.
```
        duthost.command("ip route flush %s/32" % ip.ip)
        # The ping here is workaround for known issue:
        # https://github.com/Azure/SONiC/issues/387 Pre-ARP support for static route config
        # When there is no arp entry for next hop, routes learnt from exabgp will not be set down to ASIC
        # Also because of issue https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/issues/5185 ping is done before route addition.
        duthost.shell("ping %s -c 3" % ip.ip)

```
@pavel-shirshov, is this because you did not add the vlan ipv6 address for this t0-112 topology?
@pavel-shirshov Hi Pavel, could you help to confirm?

@lguohan I added prefixes to 116
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/pull/1982/files#diff-2311d16f9455ea9d08e6a22752de53eeR144
we also see this test failure with the recent 201911 community images.
@keboliu Can you please check that your DUT has ipv6 addresses assigned to vlan interfaces?
wonder if you need to modify the this section? https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/ansible/doc/README.testbed.VsSetup.md#use-ceos-image-experimental

reviews.body: not all developer has the docker registry setup. I think we should still maintain the existing option.

comments.body: Looks good to me. @yxieca to review again, please.

latestReviews.body: One thing this test misses, is that you should have a clean up method in the end to check if all critical processes are running, if not, then you need to recover the DUT so that next test case will have a clean run. I think you should address this issue, the other issues can come back as follow up PR.

reviews.body:
As comments.

Also, I suggest creating a global logger instance which is instantiated with the file name, so that log messages include the file name, See https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/blob/master/tests/common/config_reload.py#L4 for an example.
